gametools

Class Game

  • java.lang.Object
    • gametools.Game

  • public abstract class Game
extends java.lang.Object
    Manages game input, the game window and the output displayed.

    • Constructor Summary

      Constructors 
      Constructor and Description
      Game()
      Initializes the game and runs the window method.

    • Method Summary

      All Methods Static Methods Instance Methods Abstract Methods Concrete Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description

      Initializes the game and creates the window.

      static boolean mousePressed() 
      static boolean mousePressed(int button)
      Used to determine whether a button on the mouse is currently pressed by the user.
      static java.awt.Graphics2D painter()
      The 2D graphics object is referenced here.
      abstract void run()
      Method that updates at the specified FPS (the default is 60) that should contain most the main game code.
      protected void setBackground(java.awt.Color color)
      Sets the color that the screen is repainted to every frame.
      protected void setDimensions(java.awt.Dimension dimensions)
      Sets both the width and height of the game.
      Note: This function will not work after the create function is executed.
      protected void setDimensions(int width, int height)
      Sets both the width and height of the game.
      Note: This function will not work after the create function is executed.
      protected void setFPS(int fps)
      Sets the rough amount of frames the game should display every second.
      protected void setHeight(int height)
      Sets the height of the game.
      Note: This function will not work after the create function is executed.
      protected void setTitle(java.lang.String title)
      Sets the title to display at the top of the game window.
      abstract void setup()
      Method that runs only once for initializing objects and running setup code.
      protected void setWidth(int width)
      Sets the width of the game.
      Note: This function will not work after the create function is executed.
      abstract void window()
      Method for creating window and adjusting game settings.

        The width of the screen.

      • getDimensions

        public static java.awt.Dimension getDimensions()
        Returns:
        The height of the screen.

      • painter

        public static java.awt.Graphics2D painter()
        The 2D graphics object is referenced here. It can be used for drawing basic shapes, lines, images and text.
        Returns:
        The 2D graphics object that should be used for displaying all graphical output in the game.

      • getMouseX

        public static int getMouseX()
        Returns:
        The x position of the mouse within the game window.

      • getMouseY

        public static int getMouseY()
        Returns:
        The y position of the mouse within the game window.

      • getFPS

        public static int getFPS()
        Returns:
        The rough FPS the game is running at.

      • getMousePosition

        public static java.awt.Point getMousePosition()
        Returns:
        The full mouse coordinates stored within a point.

      • getBackgroundColor

        public static java.awt.Color getBackgroundColor()
        Returns:
        The background color that the screen is repainted to every frame.

      • getTitle

        public static java.lang.String getTitle()
        Returns:
        The title of the game window.

      • setTitle

        protected void setTitle(java.lang.String title)
        Sets the title to display at the top of the game window. The default is no title.
        Parameters:
        title - The new title for the game window.

      • setBackground

        protected void setBackground(java.awt.Color color)
        Sets the color that the screen is repainted to every frame. The default is black.
        Parameters:
        color - The color that the screen is repainted to every frame. The default is black.

      • setFPS

        protected void setFPS(int fps)
        Sets the rough amount of frames the game should display every second. The default is 60.
        Parameters:
        fps - The FPS the game should run at.

      • setWidth

        protected void setWidth(int width)
        Sets the width of the game.
        Note: This function will not work after the create function is executed.
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the game.

      • setHeight

        protected void setHeight(int height)
        Sets the height of the game.
        Note: This function will not work after the create function is executed.
        Parameters:
        height - The height of the game.

      • setDimensions

        protected void setDimensions(int width,
                             int height)
        Sets both the width and height of the game.
        Note: This function will not work after the create function is executed.
        Parameters:
        width - The width of the game.
        height - The height of the game.

      • setDimensions

        protected void setDimensions(java.awt.Dimension dimensions)
        Sets both the width and height of the game.
        Note: This function will not work after the create function is executed.
        Parameters:
        dimensions - The dimensions of the game.

      • mousePressed

        public static boolean mousePressed()
        Returns:
        True if any button on the mouse is currently pressed.

      • mousePressed

        public static boolean mousePressed(int button)
        Used to determine whether a button on the mouse is currently pressed by the user.
        Parameters:
        button - An integer representing the button on the mouse button being searched for (use the mouse event class to find the right integer).
        Returns:
        True if one of the mouse buttons being pressed down matches the input.

      • keyPressed

        public static boolean keyPressed()
        Returns:
        True if any button on the keyboard is currently pressed.

      • keyPressed

        public static boolean keyPressed(int key)
        Used to determine whether a key is currently pressed by the user.
        Parameters:
        key - An integer representing the key being searched for (use the key event class to find the right integer).
        Returns:
        True if one of the keys being pressed down matches the input.

      • create

        protected void create()
        Initializes the game and creates the window. Calls the setup method after creating the window and then loops the run method at the specified FPS.
        Note: This function should only be executed in the main method and only once.

      • window

        public abstract void window()
        Method for creating window and adjusting game settings.

      • setup

        public abstract void setup()
        Method that runs only once for initializing objects and running setup code.

      • run

        public abstract void run()
        Method that updates at the specified FPS (the default is 60) that should contain most the main game code.
